metadata.Title: CVE-2019-9740 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - medium
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in urllib2 in Python 2.x through 2.7.16 and urllibin Python 3.x through 3.7.3. CRLF injection is possible if the attackercontrols a url parameter, as demonstrated by the first argument tourllib.request.urlopen with \r\n (specifically in the query string after a? character) followed by an HTTP header or a Redis command. This is fixedin: v2.7.17, v2.7.17rc1, v2.7.18, v2.7.18rc1; v3.5.10, v3.5.10rc1, v3.5.8,v3.5.8rc1, v3.5.8rc2, v3.5.9; v3.6.10, v3.6.10rc1, v3.6.11, v3.6.11rc1,v3.6.12, v3.6.9, v3.6.9rc1; v3.7.4, v3.7.4rc1, v3.7.4rc2, v3.7.5,v3.7.5rc1, v3.7.6, v3.7.6rc1, v3.7.7, v3.7.7rc1, v3.7.8, v3.7.8rc1, v3.7.9.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-9740` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

idle-python2.7 - 2.7.16-3
libpython2.7 - 2.7.16-3
libpython2.7-minimal - 2.7.16-3
libpython2.7-stdlib - 2.7.16-3
libpython2.7-testsuite - 2.7.16-3
python2.7 - 2.7.16-3
python2.7-examples - 2.7.16-3
python2.7-minimal - 2.7.16-3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: python2.7 package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.7.16-3').
